The kitchen is dated with mismatched amenities, but it was clean and had everything we needed. The bathroom had mismatched linens, but was clean and met our needs. The mattresses were not the best (but acceptable) and the bedrooms lacked outlets, but everything was clean.
The window air conditioner adequately cooled the entire house. It had a nice patio, a great porch and comfortable seating.
If you are looking for a updated quaint old house to yourself with modern and matching amenities, you will be underwhelmed here, but you will have saved significantly. If you are looking for a clean, quaint old house that meets basic needs at a great price, this house is great. We enjoyed our stay and will likely stay again.

Stepping into this historic home is like entering another world where craftsmen used the surrounding timber to construct masterpiece domiciles. Everything from built in bookshelves to finely designed arched entry ways echo back to a different time. That being said, such things as central air conditioning and up to date kitchen appliances make for some very modern conveniences. It seemed like every time we needed something, it was there: That special kitchen utensil , an outdoor grill (with charcoal), condiments, blender...One can tell the owners occasionally live there because the home lacks nothing. It almost felt like we were staying at a friends house. The location is perfect for getting around the campus, or enjoying the charming downtown including a thriving Farmers Market. All in all, I highly recommend this rental for anyone who is staying in the area. It was an experience we will likely never forget.
-Robert
